content: the knitted headband is easy to make with beginner knitters in mind using knit and purl stitches you will create the fisherman s rib stitch this headband will be super cozy to wear in the cold weather there is a video tutorial and step-by-step photographs to help you with this project as well as a condensed version of the pattern yarn bulky yarn 05/chunky/12-ply i used 1 ball of west yorkshire spinners chunk roving re treat in the color quiet 1015 one ball is 100g/153 yards/140m needles pair of 6 mm us 10 knitting needles skills level - basic this is a basic level knitting pattern and the techniques involved are casting on the knit stitch purl stitch and casting off sizing adult s/m = length 20 inches width = 5 inches to fit a head with a circumference size of around 22-24 inches you can adjust the length easily by working fewer or more row depending on your head circumference size don t forget to follow handy little me on social media for more updates and to share your finished projects instagram @handylittleme facebook facebook com/handylittleme ravelry ravelry com/people/handylittleme pinterest pinterest co uk/handylittleme copyright the pattern and photographs of this design are the property of handy little me this pattern and design are subject to copyright and are for personal non-commercial use only you may not distribute or sell this pattern or any items created using the directions in this pattern without consent please visit my terms of use page for additional information
